body: More generic to take the the chainparams petname. Maybe assert that is equal to CBaseChainParams::REGTEST.

Instead of abusing MineBlocksOnDemand(), maybe a new attribute in CChainParams?
What about fAllowOverwriteBuriedSoftforks?
We don't even need a new getter, CChainParams is accessed as a const ref everywhere outside chainparams.cpp.
Concept ACK
This is not necessary anymore.
Is the getter necessary? Params() already returns a const ref, why not use Params().fAllowsOverriddenSoftFork directly in init (making fAllowsOverriddenSoftFork public)?
I'm following the coding style of previous code in CChainParams which does not expose the fields.
utACK 3502867
fair enough
Nit: Would it make sense to revert https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8391/files#diff-30641a8ce712805f484b8305049f04b3 to the old code as well?
diff_hunk:
@@ -43,7 +43,7 @@ def __init__(self):
     def setup_network(self):
         # Must set the blockversion for this test
         self.nodes = start_nodes(self.num_nodes, self.options.tmpdir,
-                                 extra_args=[['-debug', '-whitelist=127.0.0.1', '-blockversion=3']],
+                                 extra_args=[['-debug', '-whitelist=127.0.0.1', '-blockversion=3', '-buriedsfparams=bip65:1351']],

body: Nit: I think keeping this the way it was is just fine. (Note that `fAllowsOverriddenSoftFork` is not really a chain param, is it?)

He is creating a new one. Maybe a future testnet allows this but does not mine blocks on demand. That's why we have different properties for chainparams instead of calling IsTestnet() or IsRegtest () like we did before.

This particular change does not change anything in fact, because it is setting the buriefsf height at its default value anyway.
I can't really revert the rest. The reason is that the previous test was testing activation and enforcement. But now we don't have different height for activation and enforcement anymore.

body: @MarcoFalke  What do you mean by "fAllowsOverriddenSoftFork is not really a chain param" ? where would you put it ?
I have in mind you changed the heights for enforcement to be the same for all tests? So you could revert the patch that makes the test mine additional blocks and reduce `buriedsfparams` accordingly.

body: @MarcoFalke I reverted the python test height to old value, as well as deactivating the buried soft forks by default on regtest.
What is the status here?

I think it is ready, would appreciate some feedback. As suggested by @sdaftuar on https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/8391#issuecomment-237584871 I did a small [BIP draft](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1vhE91A_GFJkB6BdoqcnaW5Q2zvnBbM2MPSwiL7h6LEc/edit?usp=sharing) for buried deployments as well.
Agree with using a new attribute.
What is not necessary anymore?
If you make the bip34 height configurable, you should also make the hash configurable, or this test will fail.
I'd say this is fine as a chain param.
